intro: Parastranthus ericoides, commonly known as the silverleaf bush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
